verses.verse: ((1 The Prophet lamenting the miserable estate of the people, and the decay of all good order, desireth God speedily to send succor to his children.7 Then comforting himself, and others with the assurance of God’s help, he commendeth the constant verity that God observeth in keeping his promises.) ) Help Lord, for there is not a godly man left: for the faithful are failed from among the children of men.

They speak deceitfully every one with his neighbor, (He meaneth the flatterers of the court which hurt him more with their tongues, than with their weapons.) flattering with their lips, and speak with a double heart.
The Lord cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things:
Which have said, (They think themselves able to persuade whatsoever they take in hand.) With our tongue will we prevail; our lips are our own; who is Lord over us?

(The Lord is moved with the complaints of his, and delivereth in the end from all dangers.) Now for the oppression of the needy, and for the sighs of the poor, I will up, saith the Lord, and will (Because the Lord’s word and promise is true and unchangeable, he will perform it and preserve the poor from this wicked generation.) set at liberty him, whom the wicked hath [snared].
The words of the Lord are pure words, as the silver, tried in a furnace of earth, fined sevenfold.
Thou wilt keep (That is, thine though he were but one man.) them, O Lord; thou wilt preserve him from this generation forever.
The wicked walk on every side; when they are exalted, (For they suppress the godly and maintain the wicked.) it is a shame for the sons of men.
